intro: Agrostophyllum alticola, commonly known as the mountain grass-leaf plant, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Poaceae, which includes grasses. It is native to the mountainous regions of South America, particularly in countries like Argentina and Chile. The plant is characterized by its slender, grass-like leaves and small, inconspicuous flowers that are typically clustered in dense inflorescences. It thrives in high-altitude environments with cool temperatures and well-drained soils. Due to its habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and specialized species within its native range.
